unit_learning_outcomes.description: communicate media/creative industries discourse in appropriate styles and formats.
connect, synthesize, and apply theoretical knowledge to employment and project contexts
integrate reflective practice and self-management tactics to improve employability.
develop professional, collaborative, and interpersonal skills to navigate the interconnected and fast-paced global workplace

enrolment_rules.description: Admission to MMediaComm or MCrInd and permission by special approval

assessments.description: Students will submit a portfolio of work that shows their progress of learning in this unit, including key tasks related to professional development, career management, reflective practice, and relevant theoretical knowledge and professional practice. A reflective portfolio introduction needs to be included. Students are expected to synthesise and apply theoretical knowledge relevant to employment contexts in ways that underpin the portfolio task. Refer to iLearn for further information.
Students are assessed on their participation activities. These activities focus on professional skills, career management, and reflection skills. Refer to iLearn for further information.

Students will complete online quizzes that will assess their knowledge and understanding of unit content, including key professional practices in the media and creative industries. Refer to iLearn for further information.

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: The objective of this unit is for students to develop professional media and creative skills. Students demonstrate their skills across a variety of formats in either project design, aesthetics, and management, or creative entrepreneurship tactics and strategies. This unit promotes learning through participation with community partners as well as the development of graduate capabilities and professional skills.
data.title: Professional Practices
